root.name: Shining Force II
root.description: Ancient SealingShining Force 2 opens follwing the thief Slade as he attempts to steal two precious jewels from an ancient shrine. Unbeknown to him these jewels are actually the seal on Zeon, the Devil King, and by stealing them he has let a great evil forth upon the world.In the kingdom of Granseal stands the Tower of the Ancients. The king of Granseal is attacked by an unleashed devil and it falls upon Sir Astral and his pupils, led by the protagonist Bowie, to investigate the attack and the strange occurences at the Tower. Bowie, the other students of Sir Astral and the mysterious Phoenix Peter will form the basis of the Shining Force; their mission will take them across the world and pit their forces against Zeon's in an attempt to seal him away once again.The Shining Force The game is focussed on your team of warriors known as the Shining Force. There are several different classes in the game, but they fall under the general areas of melee combat, ranged combat, and magical combat. As they level up they will learn new abilities and more powerful versions of their current abilities, but for the most part they will be increasing in attack, defense, hit points, magic points, and other standard RPG statistical categories. Most characters will also have the ability to be promoted (at level 20 and beyond) to some upgraded class as well; the promoted classes bring even more powerful attacks and abilities to the force. In some cases promotion may even completely change a character's focus, for instance the priest can be promoted to a master monk which is much more powerful physically but loses many of its healing powers. However, when a unit is promoted it will become level 1 in it's new class. This penalty is somewhat mitigated by waiting until later levels to promote the character, but at the same time the promotion classes are much more powerful in some cases, so the decision is a tough one for the player.To Battle! Battles in Shining Force 2 involve tactical missions in which 12 (or less) members of your band face off against a group of enemies. The goal is simple: either defeat all the enemies or their leader. However, you have to be careful, as you will lose if your leader, Bowie, is killed. Unlike most tactical RPG's there is no game over though. You will be revived in the last Church and given the opprotunity to fight the battle again with any experience or items you earned before you died.Combat takes place in standard tactical RPG fashion. The battle takes place on a grid of squares and each character occupies a single square with the exception of some of the most powerful characters in the game. Each character will get the chance to move and perform an action on their turn. The amount of movement is dictated by the characters class and the terrain they are fighting on. After moving there is four actions:Attack Attacking allows your character to enter combat with the enemy. There are two basic types of attacks: melee and ranged. Melee attacks may be made against enemies that are adjacent to the character. Ranged attacks can attack enemies that are two, three, or even more spaces away from the attacking character, but generally cannot be preformed against enemies that are directly adjacent. Some weapons, like spears, allow the character to make melee or ranged attack, but they are generally short ranged. Magic Magic spells generally have a larger range similar to ranged attacks. Generally as the magic attack gets more powerful it also has a larger area of effect, as well as a higher cost. Spells range from elemental magic to summoning to healing magic and death magic. Items Each character can carry four items at any given time. Most character use a melee weapon so effectively each character has three spots for items. Most of the time these will be healing items such as healing seeds or antidotes, but since you lack a communal item storage anything that you wish to carry must be carried by a character in the force. In battle items are generally used on the characters holding them or someone adjacent, but items like Healing Rain will affect all friendly characters. Stand By The last command is to stand by which ends the character's turn. Leading the Force In between battles the game takes many cues from standard RPG traditions. As Bowie the player will explore towns, talk to NPCs, buy items, and generally manage the force. The Church Most towns have a local church which provides several essential services to the Shining Force. At the church you canremove curses or poisons from force membersrevive members that have fallen in battle. Note that if Bowie dies he is automatically revived, as is Peter, the phoenix. promote members to a new class if they are between levels 20 and 40save your game HeadquartersMost towns also have a headquarters which lets you manage who will appear in your battle party and distribute items amongst all of your characters. Later in the game you will get access to a moving headquarters so you are no longer bound to being in a town to deal with these management tasks. This is especially useful for carrying around extra items in case there are no nearby towns in between encounters.Differences from Shining Force While Shining Force 2 is a sequel to the original game the stories are not directly related, but they are in some way connected by Shining Force Gaiden: Final Conflct for the Game Gear.There are several other differences:The game is no longer broken into chapters. This allows for a lot more exploration and allows you to go back to areas earlier in the game.The interface is vastly improved.There is more breadth in the character classes.
